content.text:
## Analysis of the Main Target Image

The target structure consists of 7 building blocks arranged in 4 layers:

1. Bottom layer: Red/orange arched block
2. Middle-lower layer: Yellow rectangular block (horizontal orientation)
3. Middle-upper layer: Two orange cylindrical pillars
4. Top layer: Yellow rectangular block (horizontal orientation) with an orange triangular roof

The spatial arrangement shows:
- The arched block serves as the base
- A horizontal yellow rectangular block rests on top of the arched block
- Two orange cylindrical pillars stand upright on the first yellow block
- A second yellow horizontal rectangular block sits on top of the cylinders
- An orange triangular roof block sits on top of the upper yellow block

## Block Selection from Dictionary

Based on the target image, I need these blocks:
1. Red/orange arched block - matches index 2 (arch facing forward)
2. Yellow horizontal rectangular blocks (2 needed) - match index 6
3. Orange cylindrical pillars (2 needed) - match index 9
4. Orange triangular roof - matches index 13

## Assembly Order

{
   Step1: Move block with index 2
   Step2: Move block with index 6
   Step3: Move block with index 9
   Step4: Move block with index 9
   Step5: Move block with index 6
   Step6: Move block with index 13
}

The assembly starts from the bottom, building up layer by layer, with the two identical cylindrical pillars positioned side by side in steps 3 and 4.
